intro: Pterophylla samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan starflower, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Samoa and nearby regions in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other showy, often colorful flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, brightly colored flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Pterophylla samoensis is adapted to grow in coastal and sandy soils, often found in open habitats along the shoreline.
